FuncDef:
The configuration prevent-misoperation disable command disables the re-confirmation function when an undo command is run.
The undo configuration prevent-misoperation disable command enables the re-confirmation function when an undo command is run.
By default, the re-confirmation function is enabled when an undo command is run.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you run some undo commands by mistake, configurations of related features are deleted, causing interruption of services or networks. To avoid misoperations, re-confirmation is required by default when running the following commands: undo mpls, undo mpls te, undo mpls rsvp, undo mpls ldp, undo mpls l2vpn, undo multicast ipv6 routing-enable, undo multicast routing-enable, undo pim, undo igmp, undo bfd, and undo stp enable.
Precautions
You are advised to enable the function because misoperations will cause services to be unavailable.
